intro: Adonis phoenicea, commonly known as the Phoenix lily, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are palmately divided, and the flowers consist of numerous stamens surrounding a single pistil. Adonis phoenicea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has cultural significance in some regions.
